alert.note: Alert for Denton; Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 8:46PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Denton and north central Tarrant Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roanoke, or near Keller, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewisville, Flower Mound, Grapevine, The Colony, Southlake, Corinth, Highland Village, Trophy Club, Lake Lewisville, Little Elm, Roanoke, Argyle, Hickory Creek and Double Oak. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35W between mile markers 62 and 79. Interstate 35E between mile markers 448 and 464. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
